column4: I just installed Ubuntu on my new laptop. I'm used to Xubuntu. How do I add workspaces to GNOME? I can't find it for the life of me.
I'm using Xfce, and I can't recall :(
dang, I'm so used to the xfce way.
oh I think I figured it out
right click the workspace switcher applet, then preferences
you can just middle click the desktop and "add Workspace".
ah, didn't know that :)
that just gives me a dialog that asks how many rows I want the workspaces to be displayed as.
isn't there a number of workspaces box?
not that I can see. :(
using Gutsy, so that may be why.
ah
OT, but are you connecting from work? and my Workspace Applet help page sez its something under Workspaces, but they must have changed in Gutsy's GNOME version
I'm at home.
ah, ok, your hostmask suggested some sort of corporation :)
nah, just an odd ISP.
can't you go SYstem -> Administration -> Mouse or something
i forgot
yes, but that doesn't give enough options.
about?
I like Thunderbird better, if thats what you're asking
what do you mean?
